column11: One day Anna and Julia go to the market.
column13: Julia says: “Look, bananas! Let’s buy some!”
column15: The seller asks: “How many bananas do you need?”
column16: S2P04|How many bananas do you need?
column20: Anna needs to buy at least 3 bananas.
column24: Julia needs to buy at least 4 bananas.
column26: S2P09|Anna needs to buy fewer bananas than Julia.
column37: Anna has to pay more coins than Julia.
column39: S2P14|Anna has to pay exactly 2 more coins than Julia.
column41: Anna and Julia pay and leave.
column43: Then Julia sees pots and knives.
column46: Anna asks the seller: “How much are the knives?”
column49: The seller says: “Small knives are 5 coins each. Big knives are 7 coins each.”
column51: Julia asks the seller: “How much are the pots?”
column53: The seller says: “Small pots are 4 coins each. Big pots are 9 coins each.”
column55: Julia says: “Wow! Pots can be more expensive than Knives! I didn’t know that.”
column59: S2P22|Julia needs to pay less than Anna.
column62: Anna goes home to her kids.
column63: Anna gives many bananas to her kids.
column64: But her kids are unhappy, because Anna is very strict.
column67: Anna makes her kids work day and night.
column69: S2P25a|Anna lets her kids play so little!
column70: S2P25b|Because the kids can play so little, they are very sad.
column72: Julia gives few bananas to her kids.
column73: But her kids are happy, because Julia is very nice.
column74: S2P26|Julia's kids have to work less hard than Anna’s kids.
column77: Julia lets her kids play day and night.
column80: S2P28a|Julia lets her kids work so little!
column81: S2P28b|Because they can work so little, the kids play all the time.
column83: Anna and Julia are sisters, but they are so different!
